subclassFeature.name: College of Blood
entries: In the darkest depths of these twisted lands, few things are as welcomed as a good laugh, a merry sond and a razor sharp blade. Bards of the College of Blood masquerade as Jesters and bring all of these in spades. Armed with a scickle and lute, these maniacal minstrels are as versatile as they are deadly.

subclassFeature.name: Harvest
entries: When you join the College of Blood at 3rd level, you learn to use your weapons with a very twisted technique. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to cause the target creature to Bleed. You apply 1 application of bleeding for a 1st spell slot, plus 1 additional application of bleeding for each spell level higher than 1st.

A bleeding target takes damage equal to 1 hit die at the beginning of the target creature's turn, until the bleeding stops. The damage increases by 1 hit die for every bleeding application on the target creature.
At the end of each of it's turns, the target creature can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the bleeding ends.

subclassFeature.name: Inspired Mockery
entries: {@italic Look at this fool, this imbecile! Playing the hero, are you?! Ha-HAA.}

At 3rd level, mocking and humiliating your enemy comes as natural as breathing. As a bonus action, you can expend an use of your Bardic Inspiration to being relentlessly mocking a target creature. If the target creature can hear you (though it needs not to understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody Dice
entries: {@italic Pride's like a knife, it can cut deep inside... Words are like weapons, they can wound sometimes.}
At 6th level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, the creature gets 1 application of bleeding.

subclassFeature.name: Finale
entries: {@italic Combat is a power ballad - a slow build up, and a grand finale!}

At 14th level, as an action, you can expend 1 use of your Bardic Inspiration to deal damage equal to your Bardic Inspiration Die for each application of bleeding on a target creature, consuming every instance of bleeding the creature has at the moment.
